Package com.sicomsa.dmt.svc

Class AbstractGenericSvc<P,Q>

java.lang.Object
com.sicomsa.dmt.svc.AbstractSvc<P,Q>
com.sicomsa.dmt.svc.AbstractGenericSvc<P,Q>
Type Parameters:
P - resPonse, the type of response this service will return
Q - reQuest, the type of request this service will receive as a parameter.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Service<P,Q>
Direct Known Subclasses:
DescargaSvc, SolicitaSvc, VerificaSvc
public abstract class AbstractGenericSvc<P,Q> extends AbstractSvc<P,Q>
Implementation of AbstractSvc for generic messages. Those are the ones that need a token and all sign the same way.

This class implements the method addSignedContent that defines and implements a signature scheme, but needs the concrete implementation to fill the message with the specific request content and return the SOAPElement to be signed. That should be done with the implementation of the method addContent() addContent().

To create a concrete implementation of AbstractGenericSvc you need to provide implementations for the following methods:

  • public String getServiceName();
  • public String getLocation();
  • public String getSoapAction();
  • public P parseReceivedMessage(SOAPMessage message, Instant instant, Q request) throws SOAPException;
  • protected abstract SOAPElement addContent(SOAPMessage message, String rfc, Q request) throws SOAPException;

Since:
1.0
Version:
2024.10.22
Author:
Beto Lopez

  • Method Details

    • addContent

      protected abstract jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPElement addContent(jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPMessage message, String rfc, Q request) throws jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException
      Adds specific content, depending on the service implemented, to the SOAPMessage specified and returns the SOAPElement to be signed.
      Parameters:
      message - message to add content to
      rfc - RFC of the contributor that is making the WS request
      request - request to be added to the message
      Returns:
      the SOAPElement to be signed
      Throws:
      jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException - if there were SOAP related problems

    • addNamespaces

    • addSignedContent

      protected void addSignedContent(jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPMessage message, Credentials creds, Q request) throws jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException, GeneralSecurityException, SvcSignatureException
      Adds content to the specified SOAPMessage, using the specified parameters and signs the message.
      Specified by:
      addSignedContent in class AbstractSvc<P,Q>
      Parameters:
      message - to be signed after adding some content
      creds - to be used to sign the message
      request - to be used to append data to the message
      Throws:
      jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException - if there were SOAP related problems
      GeneralSecurityException - if there were security problems while signing message
      SvcSignatureException - if there were other signature related problems
